poem:
The Resignation

In shadows, whispers cut  
like knives on paper—  
Sue bends beneath their weight.  

A hundred days, nearly—  
unfinished promises hover,  
fluttering like lost feathers.  

Yet morning breaks,  
and the leaves remain—  
steady as breath,  
waiting for a new wind  
to call them onward.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Sniping and criticism: what led to Sue Gray’s resignation – and what happens now? Keir Starmer moved to shore up his top team after his embattled chief of staff Sue Gray quit following months of sniping and criticism that she acknowledged had undermined the new Labour government. Gray resigned less than a week before the Labour government was due to mark its first 100 days in office, after becoming embroiled in a political storm at". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
